title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo Github account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/rfishbase.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version rfishbase ropensci/rfishbase) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/rfishbase.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch) Push account Submit pull request home base ropensci/rfishbase

title: Authors and Citation
text: Carl Boettiger. Maintainer, author. Scott Chamberlain. Author. Duncan Temple Lang. Author. Peter Wainwright. Author. Kevin Cazelles. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: C. Boettiger, D. T. Lang P. C. Wainwright. "rfishbase: exploring, manipulating visualizing FishBase data R". : _Journal Fish Biology_ 81.6 (Nov. 2012), pp. 2030-2039. DOI: 10.1111/j.1095-8649.2012.03464.x
code: @Article{,   title = {rfishbase: exploring, manipulating and visualizing {FishBase} data from R},   author = {Carl Boettiger and Duncan {Temple Lang} and Peter Wainwright},   month = {nov},   year = {2012},   publisher = {Wiley-Blackwell},   journal = {Journal of Fish Biology},   url = {https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1095-8649.2012.03464.x}, }

title: R Interface to FishBase
text: Welcome rfishbase 4. fourth rewrite original rfishbase package described Boettiger et al. (2012). rfishbase 1.0 relied parsing XML pages served directly Fishbase.org. rfishbase 2.0 relied calls ruby-based API, fishbaseapi, provided access SQL snapshots 20 popular tables FishBase SeaLifeBase. rfishbase 3.0 side-stepped API making queries directly downloaded compressed csv tables static web host. substantially improved performance reliability, particularly large queries. release largely remained backwards compatible 2.0, added tables. rfishbase 4.0 extends static model interface. Static tables distributed parquet accessed provenance-based identifier. old functions retained, new interface introduced provide easy access fishbase tables. welcome feedback, issues questions users may encounter issues tracker GitHub: https://github.com/ropensci/rfishbase/issues

title: R Interface to FishBase
code: remotes::install_github("ropensci/rfishbase") library("rfishbase") library("dplyr") # convenient but not required

title: R Interface to FishBase
text: fishbase tables can accessed name using fb_tbl() function: can see tables using fb_tables() see list table names (specify sealifebase desired). Careful, lot ! fishbase databases grown lot decades, intended used directly end-users, may considerable work determine ’s . Keep mind many variables can estimated different ways (e.g. trophic level), thus may report different values different tables. Also note species name (SpecCode) always primary key table – many tables specific stocks even individual samples, tables reference lists species focused , meant joined tables (faoareas, etc). Compare tables see fishbase.org, ask issues forum advice!
code: fb_tbl("ecosystem") # A tibble: 157,870 × 18    autoctr E_CODE Ecosy…¹ Specc…² Stock…³ Status Curre…⁴ Abund…⁵ LifeS…⁶ Remarks      <int>  <int>   <int>   <int>   <int> <chr>  <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>    1       1      1   50628     549     565 native Present <NA>    adults  <NA>     2       2      1     189     552     568 native Present <NA>    adults  <NA>     3       3      1     189     554     570 native Present <NA>    adults  <NA>     4       4      1   79732     873     889 native Present <NA>    adults  <NA>     5       5      1    5217     948     964 native Present <NA>    adults  <NA>     6       7      1   39852     956     972 native Present <NA>    adults  <NA>     7       8      1   39852     957     973 native Present <NA>    adults  <NA>     8       9      1   39852     958     974 native Present <NA>    adults  <NA>     9      10      1     188    1526    1719 native Present <NA>    adults  <NA>    10      11      1     188    1626    1819 native Present <NA>    adults  <NA>    # … with 157,860 more rows, 8 more variables: Entered <int>, #   Dateentered <dttm>, Modified <int>, Datemodified <dttm>, Expert <int>, #   Datechecked <dttm>, WebURL <chr>, TS <dttm>, and abbreviated variable names #   ¹​EcosystemRefno, ²​Speccode, ³​Stockcode, ⁴​CurrentPresence, ⁵​Abundance, #   ⁶​LifeStage fish <- c("Oreochromis niloticus", "Salmo trutta")  fb_tbl("species") %>%    mutate(sci_name = paste(Genus, Species)) %>%   filter(sci_name %in% fish) %>%    select(sci_name, FBname, Length) # A tibble: 2 × 3   sci_name              FBname       Length   <chr>                 <chr>         <dbl> 1 Oreochromis niloticus Nile tilapia     60 2 Salmo trutta          Sea trout       140

title: R Interface to FishBase
text: default, tables downloaded first time used. rfishbase defaults download latest available snapshot; aware recent snapshot may months behind latest data fishbase.org. Check available releases:

title: R Interface to FishBase
text: limited RAM (e.g. <= 1 GB available) may helpful use fishbase tables remote form setting collect = FALSE. allows tables remain disk, user still able use almost dplyr functions (see dbplyr vignette). table appropriately subset, user need call dplyr::collect() use generic non-dplyr functions, plotting commands.

title: R Interface to FishBase
text: Set option “rfishbase_local_db” = TRUE create local copy, otherwise use remote copy. Local copy get better performance initial import, may experience conflicts duckdb upgraded multiple sessions attempt access directory. Remove default storage directory (given db_dir()) upgrading duckdb using local copy. Users can trigger one-time download fishbase tables (list desired tables) using fb_import(). ensure later use function can operate smoothly even internet connection available. table already downloaded re-downloaded. (Note: fb_import() also returns remote duckdb database connection tables, users prefer work remote data objects.)
code: options("rfishbase_local_db" = TRUE) db_disconnect() # close previous remote connection  conn <- fb_conn() conn <duckdb_connection 5fa20 driver=<duckdb_driver 543a0 dbdir='/home/cboettig/.local/share/R/rfishbase/fishbase_23.01' read_only=FALSE bigint=numeric>> fb_import() <duckdb_connection 5fa20 driver=<duckdb_driver 543a0 dbdir='/home/cboettig/.local/share/R/rfishbase/fishbase_23.01' read_only=FALSE bigint=numeric>>

title: R Interface to FishBase
text: RStudio users can also browse fishbase tables interactively RStudio connection browser using function fisbase_pane(). Note function first download complete set fishbase tables.

title: R Interface to FishBase
text: rfishbase 4.0 tries maintain much backwards compatibility possible rfishbase 3.0. parquet preserves native data types, encoded types may differ earlier versions. , always native type – e.g. fishbase encodes boolean (logical TRUE/FALSE) values integer (-1, 0) character types. Use .logical() coerce appropriate type case. Toggling fishbase sealifebase servers using environmental variable, FISHBASE_API, now deprecated. Note fishbase store downloaded files hash app directory, given db_dir(). default location can set configuring desired path environmental variable, FISHBASE_HOME. Please note package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: List available releases — available_releases
code: available_releases(server = c("fishbase", "sealifebase"))

title: List available releases — available_releases
text: Lists available releases (year.month format).   use specific release, set desired release using `options(FISHBASE_VERSION=)`, shown examples.  Otherwise, rfishbase use latest available version option unset.  NOTE: necessary  clear cache `clear_cache()` restarting R session fresh environment.

title: List available releases — available_releases
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() available_releases() options(FISHBASE_VERSION="19.04") ## unset options(FISHBASE_VERSION=NULL) }

title: brains — brains
code: brains(   species_list = NULL,   fields = NULL,   server = getOption("FISHBASE_API", "fishbase"),   version = get_latest_release(),   db = default_db(server, version),   ... )

title: brains — brains
text: species_list vector scientific names (element "genus species"). empty, table fish returned. fields character vector specifying fields (columns) returned. default, available columns recognized parser returned.  Mostly backwards compatibility users can subset column later server can set either "fishbase" "sealifebase" switch databases. NOTE: usually easier leave NULL set source instead using environmental variable `FISHBASE_API`, e.g. `Sys.setenv(FISHBASE_API="sealifebase")`. version version string database, default latest release. see [get_releases()] details. db ... unused; backwards compatibility

what:
A table of all the the species found in FishBase, including taxonomic
classification and the Species Code (SpecCode) by which the species is

title: length_length — length_length
text: table contains relationships conversion one length type another 8,000 species fish, derived different publications, e.g. Moutopoulos Stergiou (2002) Gaygusuz et al (2006), fish pictures, e.g. Collette Nauen (1983), Compagno (1984) Randall (1997). relationships, always refer centimeters, may consist either regression linking two length types, form:  Length type (2) = + b x Length type (1) Length type (2) = b' x Length type (1) available length types , elsewhere FishBase, TL = total length; FL = fork length; SL = standard length; WD = width (rays); OT = type (specified Comment field). version equation (1) presented, length range, number fish used regression, sex correlation coefficient presented, available. version equation (2) presented, range correlation coefficient omitted, ratio (2) usually estimated single specimen, fish covering narrow range lengths.

title: length_weight — length_weight
text: See references official documentation.  FishBase.org: Length-weight relationships important fisheries science,  notably raise length-frequency samples total catch, estimate biomass underwater length observations.  units length weight FishBase centimeter gram, respectively.  Thus length-weight relationships cm-g, intercept ''  transformed follows: '(cm, g) = (mm, g)*10^b '(cm, g) = (cm, kg)*1000 '(cm, g) = (mm, mg)*10^b/1000 '(cm, g) = (mm, kg)*10^b*1000 However, published length-weight relationships sometimes difficult use, may based length measurement type (e.g., fork length) different ones length measurements (expressed e.g., total length). Therefore, facilitate conversion length types, additional LENGTH-LENGTH table, #' presented , devised presents linear regressions ratios linking length types (e.g., FL vs. TL).  included calculated field weight 10 cm fish (order 10 g normal, fusiform shaped fish), allow identification gross errors, given knowledge body form species.

what: The new R interface to Fishbase, v2.0 — rfishbase-package
title: The new R interface to Fishbase, v2.0 — rfishbase-package
text: programmatic interface FishBase, re-written based accompanying 'RESTful' API. Access tables describing 30,000 species fish, biology, ecology, morphology, . package also supports experimental access SeaLifeBase data, contains nearly 200,000 species records types aquatic life covered FishBase.'

text: Carl Boettiger carl@ropensci.org Scott Chamberlain scott@ropensci.org

title: synonyms — synonyms
code: synonyms(   species_list = NULL,   server = getOption("FISHBASE_API", "fishbase"),   version = get_latest_release(),   db = default_db(),   ... )

title: synonyms — synonyms
text: species_list vector scientific names (element "genus species"). empty, table fish returned. server can set either "fishbase" "sealifebase" switch databases. NOTE: usually easier leave NULL set source instead using environmental variable `FISHBASE_API`, e.g. `Sys.setenv(FISHBASE_API="sealifebase")`. version version string database, default latest release. see [get_releases()] details. db ... unused; backwards compatibility

title: synonyms — synonyms
text: table information synonym. generally single row species name given.  FishBase SpecCode given, synonyms matching SpecCode shown, table indicates one Valid FishBase. may may match valid name Catalog Life (Col), also shown table. See examples details.

title: validate_names — validate_names
text: Check alternate versions scientific name return scientific names FishBase recognizes valid
